item.title: Re-imagining a Data Visualization: Good Schools, Affordable Homes (New York Times)
item.description: A few weeks ago, a Junk Charts post critical of the New York Times article, Good Schools, Affordable Homes: Finding Suburban Sweet Spots, provided a few recommendations and criticisms for improving the data visuals within the article. Here they are summarized: Add a legend to explain the differences in the size of the dots (population?) Explain the horizontal scale (x-axis = grad above or below national or state average?) Aggregate the data (by metro area and commute time) I decided to take the NYT data and plot it out in R while taking into account the considerations above, as best I can.
